column4: uhm, are you sure that sort of thing isn't handled by NetBIOS rather than DNS?
names or Windows networks are handled by NetBIOS as far as i know, not by DNS
what?  usernames are handled by the login server
yes, and names and domains by NetBIOS
i mean, i have a machine called "ljlbox", and i can type "\\ljlbox" from another machine *without* "ljlbox" being anywhere in a DNS record
guess so, but i suggest you just leave it the way it is by default. if you need to *stay* root for a while, you can simply use "sudo -i", that's as easy as it gets
oh geez...oh Lord have mercy on my computer's soul!
what's described in the howto is correct
at any rate, just using sudo really works fine if you can take my word for it
the HD temperature is *one* SMART parameters (though HDs also report it separately, i believe), but it's far from the *only* important parameter about your drive's health
well, how does one get ALL of the SMART parameters?
useless, been done already N times
